original_title: Sri Lanka banks to operate normally as DDO goes through parliament: CB Governor
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s banks will operate as usual as a ‘domestic debt optimization’ goes though through cabinet and parliamentary committees during five days of holidays, Central Bank Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe said.
Sri Lanka’s banks and financial markets will be closed on Friday June 30 with Thursday (Hajj) and Monday (Poya Day) also statutory holidays.
“The domestic debt optimization has been discussed with the finance ministry and central bank and has come to the final stage,” Governor Weerasinghe told reporters.

“To implement it cabinet approval, parliament committees like on public finance and other committees need time to discuss it. When June 30 is a bank holiday there is a 5-day period to complete this process.”
Banks will operate as any normal holiday with automatic teller machine and online banking will operate as usual.
“We can certify that bank and non-bank deposits or interest will not be reduced or harmed in any way,” Weerasinghe said.
Party leaders are expected to meet this week to decide on weekend sessions on July 01 and 02 to debate the debt re-structuring strategy.

Sri Lanka has to re-structure domestic debt to meet gross financing need ceilings set by the International Monetary Fund to make debt ‘sustainable’.
